results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE d.name LIKE 'Sales%' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2024;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, AVG(e.salary) AS avg_salary FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.* FROM customers c WHERE c.credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT * FROM sales_orders WHERE status = 'pending') AS subquery LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM products p JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.name FROM warehouses w LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, v.vendor_number, v.name, v.email FROM vendors v WHERE v.is_active = 'true' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT a.name FROM account_types a JOIN chart_of_accounts c ON a.type_id = c.account_type_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT ba.account_number AS account_number, ba.bank_name, ba.current_balance FROM bank_accounts ba LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id AS AssetID, fa.name AS Name, fa.description, fa.purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT lt.name FROM leave_types lt LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT tc.* FROM employee_training et JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT stage_id FROM sales_opportunities LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.name FROM countries AS c LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT um.name AS unit_name, um.abbreviation, um.conversion_factor FROM units_of_measure um LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT fy.year FROM fiscal_years fy LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT ac.name FROM asset_categories AS ac JOIN fixed_assets AS fa ON ac.category_id = fa.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE e.hire_date <= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '5 year' AND s.amount > 100000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS employee_name, m.first_name || ' ' || m.last_name AS manager_name FROM employees e JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.error_message: Model did not generate SELECT statement

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title AS PositionTitle, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS EmployeeCount FROM positions p JOIN employees e ON p.position_id = e.position_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employee_salaries s JOIN employees e ON s.employee_id = e.employee_id JOIN employee_certifications ec ON e.employee_id = ec.employee_id WHERE ec.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '6 months') GROUP BY e.employee_id, ec.certification_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id AS customer_id, SUM(sales_orders.total) AS total_sales FROM sales_orders JOIN customers ON sales_orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id WHERE YEAR(sales_orders.order_date) = 2024 GROUP BY c.customer_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: missing FROM-clause entry for table "c"

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id AS customer_id, SUM(po.total) AS total_order_value FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders po ON c.customer_id = po.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id ORDER BY total_order_value DESC LIMIT 10;

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT so.* FROM sales_opportunities so JOIN opportunity_stages os ON so.stage_id = os.stage_id WHERE os.name = 'Negotiation' AND so.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.order_id AS "Order ID", COUNT(q.quote_id) AS "Quote Count", (COUNT(q.quote_id)/SUM(s.quantity)) * 100 AS "Conversion Rate" FROM sales_orders s JOIN quote_lines q ON s.order_id = q.order_id GROUP BY s.order_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column q.order_id does not exist

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.sales_rep_id AS rep_id, COUNT(s.order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders s GROUP BY s.sales_rep_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name FROM products p INNER JOIN reorder_rules r ON p.product_id = r.product_id INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id WHERE i.quantity_available < r.min_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.code AS WarehouseCode, SUM(i.quantity_on_hand * i.quantity_reserved * i.quantity_available) AS TotalInventoryValue FROM inventory_levels i JOIN warehouses w ON i.warehouse_id = w.warehouse_id GROUP BY w.code LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.sku AS product_sku, p.name AS product_name FROM products p INNER JOIN transfer_lines tl ON p.product_id = tl.product_id INNER JOIN stock_transfers st ON tl.transfer_id = st.transfer_id WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' ORDER BY p.sku LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_name, SUM(vi.amount) AS total_spend FROM vendor_invoices vi JOIN vendors v ON vi.vendor_id = v.vendor_id WHERE YEAR(fiscal_years.year) = fiscal_years.year AND fiscal_years.year = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE) GROUP BY v.vendor_name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.* FROM sales_orders s JOIN goods_receipts g ON s.order_id = g.po_id WHERE s.required_date < CURRENT_DATE AND g.receipt_date IS NULL LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(requisition_id) as total_requisitions, SUM(CASE WHEN status = 'Approved' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as approved_requisitions FROM purchase_requisitions GROUP BY department_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.error_message: Model did not generate SELECT statement

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated: SELECT j.entry_id, j.entry_number, j.entry_date, j.description, j.status FROM journal_entries AS j WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM CURRENT_DATE) AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE);
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(b.total_amount) AS total_budget, SUM(p.actual_amount) AS total_actual, (SUM(b.total_amount) - SUM(p.actual_amount)) AS budget_difference FROM departments d INNER JOIN budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id LEFT JOIN project_budgets p ON b.budget_id = p.budget_id GROUP BY d.name, b.total_amount, p.actual_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, SUM(e.amount) AS total_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses e ON p.project_id = e.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM projects AS p JOIN budgets AS b ON p.project_id = b.budget_id WHERE p.budget > b.total_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT r.project_id AS project_id, p.name AS project_name, r.employee_id AS employee_id, r.role AS role, r.allocation_percent AS allocation_percentage FROM project_resources r INNER JOIN projects p ON r.project_id = p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.category_id, SUM(fa.purchase_cost) as total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_categories ac ON fa.category_id = ac.category_id GROUP BY fa.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.* FROM fixed_assets AS fa JOIN asset_maintenance AS am ON fa.asset_id = am.asset_id WHERE am.completed_date IS NULL OR (am.completed_date > CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' AND am.status = 'due') ORDER BY completed_date ASC LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.entity_type, COUNT(d.attachment_id) AS num_documents FROM document_attachments d GROUP BY d.entity_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate employee turnover rate by department for 2024
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, COUNT(e.employee_id) FILTER (WHERE e.termination_date IS NOT NULL AND e.termination_date BETWEEN '2024-01-01' AND '2024-12-31') / COUNT(e.employee_id) * 100 AS turnover_rate FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find the salary percentile ranking for each employee within their department
results.sql_generated:
SELECT e.employee_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, d.name AS department_name, p.title AS position_title, s.salary, NTILE(100) OVER (PARTITION BY e.department_id ORDER BY s.salary) as salary_percentile FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id LEFT JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee 
                    employee_id, p.position_id, s.salary, NTILE(100) OVER (PARTITION BY e.department_id ORDER BY s.salary) as salary_percentile FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id LEFT JOIN employee_salaries LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: syntax error at or near "employee_id"

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, tc.course_id, tc.duration_hours FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id AND et.status = 'completed' LEFT JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory = true AND et.employee_id IS NULL LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', s.created_at) AS month, SUM(s.total) OVER (ORDER BY DATE_TRUNC('month', s.created_at)) / LAG(SUM(s.total), 12) OVER (ORDER BY DATE_TRUNC('month', s.created_at)) - 1 AS growth_rate FROM sales_orders s WHERE s.order_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '1 year' GROUP BY month ORDER BY month LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column "s.total" must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function

results.question: Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.name AS customer_segment, AVG(s.total / o.quantity) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(o.order_id) / 365 * 12 AS order_frequency FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders s ON c.customer_id = s.customer_id JOIN order_lines o ON s.order_id = o.order_id GROUP BY c.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated: SELECT opportunity_stages.name AS stage, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM opportunity_stages.expected_close_date) AS expected_close_month, SUM(sales_opportunities.amount * (1 - sales_opportunities.probability / 100)) OVER (PARTITION BY opportunity_stages.name ORDER BY opportunity_stages.sequence) AS weighted_value FROM sales_opportunities INNER JOIN opportunity_stages ON sales_opportunities.stage_id = opportunity_stages.id GROUP BY stage, expected_close_month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.name AS ProductCategoryName, SUM(il.quantity_on_hand) / AVG(p.unit_cost) AS InventoryTurnoverRatio FROM product_categories pc JOIN products p ON pc.category_id = p.category_id JOIN inventory_levels il ON p.product_id = il.product_id WHERE p.is_active = true AND il.last_count_date >= NOW() - INTERVAL '1 year' GROUP BY pc.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, i.quantity_available AS available_stock, (i.quantity_after - i.quantity_before) / NULLIF(i.quantity_before, 0) * 100 AS adjustment_percentage FROM products p INNER JOIN inventory_adjustments a ON p.product_id = a.product_id INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id WHERE (i.quantity_after - i.quantity_before) / NULLIF(i.quantity_available, 0) * 5 LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column a.product_id does not exist

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated: SELECT ac.name AS category, SUM(CASE WHEN da.type = 'debit' THEN da.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debits, SUM(CASE WHEN da.type = 'credit' THEN da.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credits FROM asset_categories ac JOIN depreciation_entries da ON ac.category_id = da.asset_id GROUP BY ac.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column da.type does not exist

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date) AS month, SUM(amount * (1 - is_reconciled)) OVER (PARTITION BY transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date)) as cash_flow 
FROM bank_transactions 
JOIN bank_accounts ON bank_transactions.bank_account_id = bank_accounts.bank_account_id 
GROUP BY transaction_type, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated:
SELECT p.project_id, b.name AS department_name, SUM(p.planned_amount) AS total_planned, SUM(e.actual_amount) AS total_actual, (SUM(p.planned_amount) - SUM(e.actual_amount)) AS profitability
FROM project_budgets p
JOIN budgets b ON p.project_id = b.project_id
LEFT JOIN project_expenses e ON p.project_id = e.project_id AND e.status = 'approved'
GROUP BY p.project_id, b.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column b.project_id does not exist

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.*, a.name AS employee_name, a.location_id FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_locations a ON fa.asset_id = a.location_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Create a comprehensive employee cost report including salary and benefits by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS DepartmentName, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS EmployeeName, SUM(bs.amount) + COALESCE(SUM(es.salary), 0) AS TotalCost FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.employee_id LEFT JOIN employee_salaries es ON e.employee_id = es.employee_id LEFT JOIN employee_benefits bs ON e.employee_id = bs.employee_id GROUP BY d.name, e.first_name, e.last_name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column bs.amount does not exist
